description: On 17 March at a meeting of a special commission of the Cabinet of Ministers, it has been announced that the validity period of a visa of foreign citizens located in the Republic of Uzbekistan will be automatically extended until 10 April 2020. Also, citizens of countries with the right to enter the country without a visa for a certain period of time (in case of violation of the established period) will be allowed to leave the country as an exception by 10 April 2020. In the above cases no measures will be taken against them. According to this decision, the Uzbek Foreign Ministry asks the leaders of hotel complexes, taking into account the current situation, to accept foreign citizens into accommodation facilities without any problems.

On September 21, Uzbek authorities have announced that the country's borders are to reopen from October 1, following a months-long closure due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Cross-border traffic and international trains and flights are expected to resume over the course of the month. Countries have been classified under a traffic light system as 'green', 'yellow', or 'red', depending on the levels of COVID-19 infection in each country, with different regulations regarding entry depending on the color. Travelers arriving from 'green' countries, which include China, Thailand, Malaysia, South Korea, Georgia, Hungary, Finland, Latvia, Austria, and Japan, will be able to enter Uzbekistan without restrictions. Those arriving from 'yellow' countries, which consist of Azerbaijan, Belarus, the UAE, and the EU (except for the UK and Spain) may enter provided they have undergone a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test in the 72 hours prior to their arrival. All other countries have been classified as 'red', and arrivals must provide a negative PCR test and undergo a 14-day quarantine to be permitted entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 16, it was announced that Tashkent City Department of Transport and Toshshahartranskhizmat intensified work on disinfection of public transport. Buses departing from bus depots in the early morning go through anti-virus sanitation by specialists from regional centers of sanitation, epidemiology and disinfection. In addition, buses and fixed-route taxis attached to Toshshahartranskhizmat are disinfected at each terminal station.

On 21 March, at a meeting of the Special Republican Commission on the preparation of a program of measures to prevent the entry and spread of coronavirus in the Republic of Uzbekistan, it was reported that, starting from March 22, only taxis disinfected by the Tashkent city center of sanitary and epidemiological welfare will run. Every taxi that goes on a route will be issued a daily disinfection certificate from the Central Bureau of Security and Safety.

description:
From 00:01 on March 24, all types of transport, including buses, cars, air and railway transport, will be closed from Tashkent. This decision was made on Monday by the Special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus, according to the telegram channel Koronavirus Info.
The restriction on entry and exit from the capital of Uzbekistan does not apply to cargo transportation. Only citizens permanently residing (registered) in Tashkent will be able to enter the city.
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: According to the order of the special commision for fighting against covid-19 in Uzbekistan on March 26, from 06:00 a.m. of 27 March 2020 the movement of trams and buses in the city of Samarkand will be suspended.

In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov.

description: From 6:00 am on March 30 to April 20, movement by car in Tashkent, Nukus and regional centers, as well as between regions, will be allowed only if there is a special permit in the form of a sticker issued by public service centers. According to the press service of the government of Uzbekistan, this decision was made by the Special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus.

According to the decision of the Special Republican Commission on April 30, only from 7:00 to 10:00 and from 17:00 to 20:00 it is allowed to use personal and service cars with passengers, as well as bicycles and motor vehicles for trips to and from work, as well as for the purchase of goods essentials, medicines, medical products and food.

In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov.
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: According to the order of the special republican commission on May 15, citizens will be able to use their personal car around the clock in regions with a green quarantine level. Without permissive stickers in the "yellow" regions, it is allowed to move from 06:00 to 22:00. In this case, there should not be more than 4 people in the cabin. In the red regions, citizens will be able to use their personal car from 07:00 to 10:00 and from 17:00 to 20:00 to travel to and from work, to buy medicines, medical supplies and essential goods.

In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov.
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Uzbekistan from 10 July to 1 August again reinforces quarantine restrictions. The Special Republican Commission for the Control of Coronavirus adopted a corresponding decision. The country introduced a ban on the movement of vehicles between regions (except for official and personal vehicles of organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural products).

Uzbekistan from 10 July to 1 August again reinforces quarantine restrictions. The Special Republican Commission for the Control of Coronavirus adopted a corresponding decision. The country introduced a ban on the movement of vehicles between regions (except for official and personal vehicles of organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural products).

According to the order of the Special Commision of Uzbekistan on March 28, due to coronavirus Namangan introduces nine days weekend from March 28 to April 5, residents are instructed not to go out unless absolutely necessary.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: According to the order of Special Comission of Uzbekistan on April 6. Uzbekistan makes selfisolation regime mandatory in Tashkent Nukus as well as regional centers. Citizens are strictly forbidden to go out unless absolutely necessary except for food medicine a doctors visit and travel to work. The movement of motorcycles and bicycles is limited. Citizens of advanced age in particular over 65 years of age and having chronic diseases are strictly prohibited from leaving home without emergency. Citizens with fever will not be allowed in large food markets and supermarkets. It is forbidden to gather on the streets in groups of more than 3 people 2 meters social distance required. It is forbidden to move without personal protective equipment masks. It is forbidden to hold weddings and other celebrations
city: Tashkent, Nukus, as well as regional centers
target_city: Tashkent, Nukus, as well as regional centers
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: According to the order of Special Comission of Uzbekistan on April 14, following all regional centers, in five major cities of Tashkent Region - Almalyk, Bekobod, Angren, Yangiyul and Chirchik - introduce self-isolation regime. Restrictions include: walking dogs should be done once a day and at a distance of no more than 100 meters from the house; citizens over 65 years of age are not allowed to leave their homes, an exception is made for trips to grocery stores and pharmacies located in the immediate vicinity of their homes; other residents should also leave their homes only for trips to grocery stores and pharmacies located in the immediate vicinity of their homes; when moving around the streets, as well as visiting trade objects and other places, it is necessary to maintain a social distance of 2 meters
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On July 10, the special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus has decided to introduce new restrictions that will be effective from July 10 to August 1. Persons over 65 years of age are not allowed to be present in public places and they must be self-isolated.

On July 11, the special Republican Commission for combating coronavirus in Uzbekistan adopted new decisions. On July 18-19, July 25-26, and August 8-9, residents were advised to self-isolate. On the same days, government agencies and other organizations were advised not to involve their employees in the work. In General, it is recommended to hold national isolation.

On July 10, the special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus has decided to introduce new restrictions that will be effective from July 10 to August 1. Persons over 65 years of age are not allowed to be present in public places and they must be self-isolated.

On January 29, The President of Uzbekistan signed a decree on the creation of a special republican commission to prepare a program of measures to prevent the importation and spread of a new type of coronavirus in Uzbekistan. The commission was headed by Prime Minister Abdulla Aripov. A special republican commission was created under the leadership of Abdulla Aripov. The commissions tasks include continuous analysis and monitoring of the global, regional and country epidemiological conditions, forecasting the trends in the spread and possible worsening of the epidemiological situation of coronavirus in the country.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On the basis of the Presidential Decree date 19.03.2020, No. UP-5969, the Republican Anti-Crisis Commission (hereinafter referred to as the Anti-Crisis Commission) was formed. The main task of the Anti-Crisis Commission is to resolve issues and ensure the work of economic sectors, social support of the population during the period of counteracting the spread of coronavirus infection. The territorial headquarters of the Anti-Crisis Commission are headed by the Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, khokims of regions, districts and cities respectively. The Prime Minister is also the head of the Anti-Crisis Commission.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 17, Starting from 18 March, teachers will go on paid leave. School principals, their deputies, managers, psychologists, janitors and caretakers will continue to work in schools. description:
Uzbekistan: Special Republican Commission on Prevention of the Covid-19 Spread approves the following measures:
"Transaction fees will not be charged on plastic cards of pensioners.

The validity period of all expired documents (licenses, permits, passports, residence permits, rights, car insurance, inspection) is automatically extended until 1 July 2020.

Private clinics will be able to provide paid coronavirus testing services until 1 September 2020.

It is allowed to trade in non-food products (clothing, household goods) through mobile points.

Until 10 May, new taxi licenses will not be issued. Taxi drivers will be required to wear special clothing (overalls, masks and gloves) in the car.

Visas to all foreign nationals are automatically renewed until 1 June 2020."
type_text: Uzbekistan: Special Republican Commission on Prevention of the Covid-19 Spread approves new measures
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On Apr. 23, Uzbek President adopted a resolution On measures to attract external assistance to support the population, budget, basic infrastructure and business entities during the coronavirus epidemic, which outlines a roadmap for attracting grants and concessional long-term financing for measures to counteract the negative consequences of the global COVID-19 pandemic.
type_text: Measures to attract grants to combat the negative consequences of COVID-19 are identified

description: "Uzbekistan's Health Ministry on [March 4] began warning people about coronavirus by sending text messages about ways of protection."

On 15 March, a call center for coronavirus infection began to operate under the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Uzbekistan.

According to the press secretary of the Tashkent Pediatric Medical Institute Khasanhodja Obidov, over the past day, he received about 20 thousand requests from the population asking for information on how this infection spreads and how to resist it.

The call center employs more than 200 healthcare professionals who provide competent information. Call center is working around the clock. You can contact him by short number 1003.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On Mar. 15, the Uzbek Health Ministry sets up call center to answer coronavirus-related questions.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: In Uzbekistan "The Central Bank recommended to minimize visits to banks for making current payments and to use remote payment methods instead, such as Internet banking, mobile applications of banks and payment systems," on March 18.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 20, The Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan created an official website http://coronavirus.uz, where users can get all the necessary information about coronavirus infection.
In particular, it refers to the epidemic situation in Uzbekistan, daily operational data, and the latest news from reliable sources. The users can also find contact details of the headquarters of the regional health departments, the operational headquarters of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the embassies of our country in foreign countries. And useful information and recommendations on how to protect the usersrself and protect the usersrself from COVID-19 helps to increase public awareness. Also on the site the users can find a list of reliable sources of information.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uzbek National Chamber of Innovative Healthcare launched a telegram channel National Chamber COVID-19 (https://t.me/uzhealth_covid2019) to collect requests from health professionals who want to help fight coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 2, The Ministry of Health of Republic of Uzbekistan announced the development and launch of an online telegram of a consultant bot together with Unified Integrator UZINFOCOM LLC to provide medically sound answers to citizens' questions. On the site, people can see the map, which shows in which regions confirmation of coronavirus infection is recorded. Secondly, under this card there is a button Epidemiological route of patients with confirmed coronavirus infection COVID-19. By clicking on it, people can trace in what places the patients managed to visit before arriving at the hospital. Having received this information, be careful not to visit these places
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: According to news on April 11, The Ministry of Health, in collaboration with the World Health Organization, has prepared the National COVID-19 Guide, which describes the necessary measures to combat coronavirus infection.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uzbekistan has placed all those who have been in "China, France, Germany, Iran, Italy, Japan, South Korea and Spain" in a 14 day quarantine, reported on Feb. 28.

description: On March 1, the Ministry of Transport of Uzbekistan has officially notified the aviation authorities and companies of the Republic of Korea about the introduction of temporary restrictive measures in air communication between the two countries from 1 March 2020. The number of flights is reduced to 1 flight per week. Arrivals arriving in Uzbekistan from South Korea will be quarantined for 14 days upon arrival.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 1, the Ministry of Transport of Uzbekistan has officially notified the aviation authorities and companies of the Republic of Korea about the introduction of temporary restrictive measures in air communication between the two countries from 1 March 2020. description: On March 1, the Ministry of Transport of Uzbekistan has officially notified the aviation authorities and companies of the Republic of Korea about the introduction of temporary restrictive measures in air communication between the two countries from 1 March 2020. The number of flights is reduced to 1 flight per week. Arrivals arriving in Uzbekistan from South Korea will be quarantined for 14 days upon arrival.

description: On March 20, Special Republican Commission organizes flights for the return of compatriots to their homeland. The Commission promptly developed a schedule of charter flights, providing for the arrival of airliners in Uzbekistan. The export of fellow citizens by charter flight from other countries will continue. Information on the departure schedule for the following days will be announced later. All citizens of Uzbekistan upon return will be placed in 14-day quarantine with strict observance of the relevant requirements and norms of the UN World Health Organization.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On 23 March, the Government of Uzbekistan adopted a resolution "On additional measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus infection."
